t: Psalm 50
God as Judge
A psalm of Asaph.
The*pn Mighty One, God, the Lord,*s speaks; he*ln summons the earth from*ln the rising of the sun to its setting.
From*ln Zion, the perfection of beauty, God*ln appears in radiance.
Our*ln God is coming; he will not be silent! Devouring*ln fire precedes him, and*ln a storm rages around him.
On*ln high, he summons heaven and earth in*ln order to judge his people:
“Gather*ln my faithful ones to me, those*ln who made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
The*ln heavens proclaim his righteousness, for*ln God is the Judge. Selah*ig
“Listen,*pn my people, and I will speak; I*ln will testify against you, Israel. I*ln am God, your God.
I*ln do not rebuke you for your sacrifices or*ln for your burnt offerings, which*ln are continually before me.
I*ln will not take a bull from your household or*ln male goats from your pens,
for*ln every animal of the forest is mine, the*ln cattle on a thousand hills.
I*ln know every bird of the mountains, and*ln the creatures of the field are mine.
If*ln I were hungry, I would not tell you, for*ln the world and everything in it is mine.
Do*ln I eat the flesh of bulls or*ln drink the blood of goats?
Offer*ln a thanksgiving sacrifice to God, and*ln pay your vows to the Most High.
Call*ln on me in a day of trouble; I*ln will rescue you, and you will honor me.”
But*pn God says to the wicked: “What*ln right do you have to recite my statutes and*ln to take my covenant on your lips?
You*ln hate instruction and*ln fling my words behind you.
When*ln you see a thief, you*ln make friends with him, and*ln you associate with adulterers.
You*ln unleash your mouth for evil and*ln harness your tongue for deceit.
You*ln sit, maligning your brother, slandering*ln your mother’s son.
You*ln have done these things, and I kept silent; you*ln thought I was just like you. But*ln I will rebuke you and*ln lay out the case before you.
“Understand*pn this, you who forget God, or*ln I will tear you apart, and*ln there will be no one to rescue you.
Whoever*ln offers a thanksgiving sacrifice honors me, and*ln whoever orders his conduct, I*ln will show him the salvation of God.”
